property.name: text
property.value: This version of the CT Sticky Masses model uses the GR domain to render the results as a three-dimensional animation.

property.name: text
property.value: This example requires Java3D. If you do not have it installed, you can get it from: http://java.sun.com/products/java-media/3D/

property.name: text
property.value: This model shows a hybrid system, which mixes continuous-time modeling with finite state machines. In this example, two point masses on springs oscillate. However, they may collide, in which case, they stick together, and oscillate together. The stickiness decays, and they eventually come apart again. This is an example of a modal model, where there are two modes, "together" and "separate". Each mode is modeled by a state in an FSM, and each state refines to a continuous-time model of the dynamics in that mode.

property.name: text
property.value: Sampler is used to provide periodic data to the 3-D animation subsystem.

property.name: text
property.value: Right click to look inside the states to see the model of the system behavior in the corresponding mode of operation.

property.name: text
property.value: The sticky masses system has two modes of operation, "Separate" and "Together," corresponding to whether the point masses are stuck together. The "init" state has a transition that is used to initialize the "Separate" model (double click on that transition to see its actions).

property.name: actions
property.value: Separate.p1 = p1; Separate.p2 = p2; Separate.v1 = v1; Separate.v2 = v2

property.name: setActions
text
property.value: This model gives two separate ordinary differential equations, one for each point mass attached to a spring. The ZeroCrossingDetector actor detects the collision of the point masses and emits the "touched" event.

property.name: text
property.value: V1 and V2 are velocities, and P1 and P2 are positions of the two masses.

property.name: text
property.value: V1 and V2 are velocities, and P1 and P2 are positions of the two masses.

property.name: text
property.value: This model gives one ordinary differential equation for the joined point masses attached to a spring. A second differential equation models the decaying stickiness.
